isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built Before June 3, 2002 - assemble - ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD

svcsubproc.title: Assembly of Anchor Plate Components

note.para:
Several changes have been incorporated within the anchor plate assembly and caliper mounting bolts on vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002. It is important to recognize that these changes are not found on disc brakes on vehicles manufactured before June 3, 2002, unless a complete rebuild of the anchor plate assembly was performed on the vehicle. The components that have changed are the leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 67)
and (Figure 68)
and caliper mounting bolts (Figure 71) .

caution.para:
When servicing vehicles manufactured before June 3, 2002, it is recommended that the old guide pins (Figure 67)
be replaced with the new leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 68)
that are used on vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002. Because of the differences in guide pins effective with brakes used on vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002, any replacement of the guide pins should be done in pairs and the correct mounting bolts (Figure 71)
and torque must be used. Refer to CALIPER, Install
for proper torque requirements.

step1.para:
Uniformly apply Shell/Albida PPS 1 grease (from 3 oz. tube in rebuild kit) to both guide pin bores (Item 2, Figure 48)
of anchor plate (Item 1, Figure 48)
and on the shaft of both leading guide pin and trailing guide pin (including rubber bushing) (Items 1 and 2, Figure 50) . Use 1/8 ounce of grease to thoroughly lube each guide pin and guide pin bore set.

Installing guide pin boots (Item 3, Figure 50) . Apply a thin coat of Shell/Albida PPS 1 grease (from 3 oz. tube in rebuild kit) to the inside opening at each end of the guide pin boot. When rebuilding the anchor plate, use new guide pin boots.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 55
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once the grease has been applied to the leading guide pin (Item 1, View A) and guide pin boot (Item 2, View A), slide the leading guide pin through the guide pin boot.

Before installing leading guide pin and trailing guide pin with rubber bushing, determine which anchor plate guide pin bore is the leading guide pin bore and which is the trailing guide pin bore. Leading guide pin bore position and trailing guide pin bore positions of the anchor plate are based on the forward rotation of the rotor and wheel hub (Items 1 and 2, Figure 56) . Leading guide pin (Item 3, Figure 56)
always goes in the first anchor plate guide pin bore as shown by forward rotation and the trailing guide pin with rubber bushing (Item 4, Figure 56)
always goes in the second anchor plate guide pin bore as shown by forward rotation, driver side shown.

Once the leading guide pin bore position has been identified, insert leading guide pin (Item 1, View B) with guide pin boot (Item 2, View B) into leading guide pin bore position (Item 3, View B) of anchor plate (Item 4, View B) until guide pin boot (Item 2, View C) is completely compressed.

Rotate leading guide pin (Item 1) 1/4 to 1/2 turn and back to seat guide pin boot (Item 2) at both ends (Item 5, View D). Inspect guide pin boot to ensure boot is fully seated all around guide pin and anchor plate boot retaining grooves (Item 5, View D).

figure.caption: Figure 55. Install Guide Pin Boot on Guide Pin and Anchor Plate Boot Grooves

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. SEATED FULLY INTO GUIDE PIN AND ANCHOR PLATE GROOVES

step1.para:
Repeat this procedure to install the trailing guide pin with rubber bushing (Item 4, Figure 56)
and guide pin boot into the trailing guide pin bore position of anchor plate. It may be necessary to use a wrench on the trailing guide pin with rubber bushing because of the snug fit in the guide pin bore.

figure.caption: Figure 56. Forward Rotation of Rotor and Wheel Hub

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. TRAILING GUIDE PIN WITH RUBBER BUSHING

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 57 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install anchor plate pad abutment slippers (Item 1) onto anchor plate abutments (Item 2) using soft brass or light hammer. Avoid marring anchor plate abutment and slipper surfaces.

On front and rear axles with 66 mm disc brakes, install 12-point head bolt plug (Item 3) into anchor plate tie bar mounting holes of the anchor plate (Item 4). Tighten to 40 to 50 ft-lbs. (54 to 68 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 57. Install Abutment Slippers and 12-Point Head Bolt Plugs

step1.para:
Once the anchor plate and splash shield has been assembled, refer to ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Install
to install the anchor plate and splash shield.
